image.altText: A woman addresses the media in a press confernece.

props.synopsis: The NT government has promised to urgently pass new bail laws to bring the territory in-line with Victoria and NSW in the wake of a fatal stabbing of a local Darwin grocer.

title.children: Bail reform promised in wake of NT supermarket stabbing

image.altText: A graphic image with a woman (the coroner) and a man (Rolfe) in greyscale, in front of a blue background with hand prints.

props.synopsis: The coroner's findings into the death of Kumanjayi Walker, an Aboriginal man shot by a Northern Territory police officer in 2019, will be handed down on June 10, 2025. It comes after a series of delays that made the coronial inquiry the longest-running and most expensive in the territory's history.

title.children: NT coroner to deliver findings into police shooting of Kumanjayi Walker

image.altText: An older man stands in front of rows of wine in a store.

props.synopsis: Police say a teenager arrested after the fatal stabbing of Linford Feick, the owner of a Friendly Grocer in Darwin, was bailed last week, just days before he turned 18.

title.children: Teen bailed a week before fatal stabbing of Darwin grocery store owner

image.altText: an aerial photo of a gold mine.

props.synopsis: A Canadian-owned mining company has pleaded guilty to sacred site damage after accidentally tipping off the regulator about its unlawful drilling at a Northern Territory sacred site.

title.children: Gold miner accidentally reveals sacred site drilling in press release

image.altText: Cocos polling

props.synopsis: Almost 6,000km from Canberra, voters on the Cocos (Keeling) Islands and Christmas Island say they're being treated as an afterthought – at best – by the candidates vying for their vote.

title.children: The polls are open, but Australia's most remote voters are feeling 'forgotten'

image.altText: Carmel stands in the school library holding a picture of Pope Francis

props.synopsis: As news of the pope’s death reverberates around the world, the Ltyentye Apurte Catholic community in Central Australia, known also as Santa Teresa, is carrying on his legacy in their own way.

title.children: One of Australia's most Catholic communities pays tribute to Pope Francis

image.altText: A Singapore Airlines plane on the tarmac at Adelaide Airport.

props.synopsis: The Coalition has promised to allow overseas airlines to fly domestic routes between Darwin and the east coast if it wins government. But would that reduce prices?

title.children: The Coalition has a plan to lower Darwin airfares, but can it work?

image.altText: An empty Darwin Waterfront precinct.

props.synopsis: The Northern Territory government has dismissed calls for an independent inquiry into allegations over the misuse of public funding at the Darwin Waterfront Corporation.

title.children: 'I am the minister': NT government shuts down call for Darwin Waterfront inquiry

image.altText: A group of traditional owners and family stand on sunny country with one person holding title deed

props.synopsis: Eileen Bonney did not think she would live to see her people's land returned but after more than four decades, the Wakaya-Alyawarre traditional owner is celebrating.

title.children: Traditional owner celebrates land return after 45-year wait

image.altText: a huge ship with beams and pipe-laying equipment

props.synopsis: Santos's offshore Barossa gas project off the coast of the Northern Territory has won final approvals from the national offshore gas regulator.

title.children: Santos's $5.6b Barossa gas project wins final regulatory approvals

image.altText: A person holds a handfull of ground nickel

props.synopsis: Australia is joining the European Union and the United States in establishing strategic reserves of critical minerals, but what do they actually do, and why are they so important?

title.children: The purpose of the government's 31 critical minerals serve and how much we have

image.altText: A graphic showing a row of chairs and signage that says 'Medicare' and 'bulk billing availabel'

props.synopsis: Two new surveys have cast doubt on whether the signature health policy of this election campaign can be delivered.

title.children: We've been promised more bulk-billing, but doctors say they can't deliver

image.altText: Damen Changde tug

props.synopsis: A new fleet of tug boats that the Defence Department ordered for the Royal Australian Navy has been secretly built at a Chinese shipyard under a $28 million contract awarded last year to a Dutch company.

title.children: Australian navy's newest boats made in China

image.altText: A man in religious garb sitting in front of a red curtain, looking on

props.synopsis: As he glided around St Peter's Square in his Popemobile on Sunday, the fact he was 88 and had just spent several weeks in hospital somehow seemed a distant memory. Then everything changed.

title.children: 'We thought it would happen a month ago': Inside Pope Francis's final days

image.altText: A mid shot of Lisa Govan posing for a photo smiling with her arms around a large dog while sitting at a table.

props.synopsis: A WA coroner indicates he'll be unable to determine how a woman died after she disappeared in Kalgoorlie more than 25 years ago.

title.children: Gang member breaks silence on woman missing from bikie clubhouse

image.altText: 2025-02-28T182007Z_1921454418_RC2T3DACDYHS_RTRMADP_3_UKRAINE-CRISIS-USA

props.synopsis: US President Donald Trump says a peace deal between Russia and Ukraine is "very close" but criticises Kyiv for refusing to recognise Crimea as Russian territory.

title.children: Trump says he has deal with Zelenskyy and Putin to end war

image.altText: Lines of blue and white police tape cross a busy city street where a police car is parked and officers stand.

props.synopsis: A 30-year-old man died from multiple stab wounds after a fight involving up to six people who allegedly chased him along Chapel Street during the early hours of Sunday morning.

title.children: A man has been charged with murder over Easter Chapel St stabbing

image.altText: Eddie Obeid arrives at court to be sentenced for misconduct in public office

props.synopsis: NSW Crime Commissioner Michael Barnes says the decision not to confiscate the money was one he did not want to make.

title.children: Jailed former NSW Labor minister to keep $30m from corrupt coal deal

image.altText: Three guides side by side

props.synopsis: Australian influencers' fitness and nutrition guides flew off the shelves in the mid-to-late 2010s, promising "bikini bodies" for the average woman. We asked the experts if their advice holds up today.

title.children: Four experts reviewed the 2010s most popular fitness guides. Here's what they said

image.altText: A man's hand writing notes in a notebook in front of ASX boards

props.synopsis: The local share market has closed on a four-week high ahead of the Anzac Day long weekend. Global stocks rallied following the US president apparently softening his stance on China and the Federal Reserve. Catch up on the day's events and insights from our business reporters on the ABC News live markets blog.

title.children: ASX closes on four-week high before Anzac Day long weekend — as it happened

image.altText: The scene of the car crash on Canberra Avenue near Burke Crescent in Griffith.

props.synopsis: Charges against a man accused of hitting two St Edmund's College students with an allegedly stolen car as they crossed the road to school last month are to be upgraded to culpable driving causing grievous bodily harm.

title.children: Man accused of hitting Canberra schoolboys with car has charges upgraded

image.altText: An older man wearing glasses with grey hair delivering a speech at a conference table, looking stern.

props.synopsis: The President of the Palestinian Authority in the West Bank has demanded the militant group free the remaining 59 Israeli hostages held in Gaza and hand over its weapons.

title.children: 'You sons of dogs': Palestinian leader blasts Hamas in hostage release demand

image.altText: close up of donald trump as he pouts his lips and raises his eyebrows

props.synopsis: He added that he expects to strike a deal and set the final tariff figure on China over the next two or three weeks.

title.children: Trump says China tariff cuts depend on Beijing's actions

image.altText: A storm cloud approaching land on an autumn afternoon

props.synopsis: From showers in the east to a chilly dawn service in the west, this is the Anzac Day weather forecast across Australia.

title.children: Parts of Australia's east set to be soaked this Anzac Day

image.altText: a beachfront carpark is cordoned off

props.synopsis: NSW Police were called to a car park shortly before midnight and found a man, believed to be 18, with a gunshot wound.

title.children: 'Senseless': Teen shot dead in Newcastle car park after group brawl

image.altText: bruce lehrmann walking outside court

props.synopsis: Rape charges against the former Liberal Party staffer have returned to a Toowoomba court, with a judge growing impatient at arguments between the legal teams.

title.children: Bruce Lehrmann rape case back in court as lawyers tangle over brief

image.altText: A detail of an old photograph showing returned soldiers

props.synopsis: A Queensland historian has researched the stories of Australia's military "rejects" and how they made vital contributions to World War I efforts.

title.children: How the 'rejects' from WWI refused to be cast aside

image.altText: a male politician wearing a suit speaking at lectern in front of party members

props.synopsis: The opposition leader is being cautious with his language as he doesn't want to turn off Chinese-Australian voters, as the Coalition did last election, but he also doesn't want to upset those on his right flank.

title.children: Peter Dutton is choosing his words carefully on China

image.altText: a man in a suit

props.synopsis: Prosecutors say Moon Jae-in has been indicted for alleged bribery over the employment of his former son-in-law at a Thai airline.

title.children: Prosecutors indict former South Korean president Moon Jae-in for bribery

image.altText: An image of a teenager's hand holding a vape.

props.synopsis: Researchers used the drug Varenicline to block the pleasant effects of nicotine on the brains of a group of 16- to 25-year-olds over a 24-week period.

title.children: Could a pill be the solution to your vaping addiction?

image.altText: A man in a navy suit and tie walks next to a silver sign with the number 3 on it

props.synopsis: The former SA Liberal leader has lost a bid to avoid being convicted over drug supply charges, with a magistrate saying the offending was "too serious" not to record convictions.

title.children: Former SA opposition leader David Speirs convicted over drug supply charges

image.altText: Men in white suits are bent over and marched through a brightly lit prison.

props.synopsis: Kilmar Abrego Garcia was sent to a brutal prison in El Salvador, even though the migrant living in the United States had never been convicted of a crime.  Now, Donald Trump is refusing to follow a Supreme Court order.

title.children: ABC News Daily: Why Trump's found an ally in El Salvador's ‘dictator’

image.altText: An image of sandstone buildings against a blue sky

props.synopsis: In New Zealand, there is now a conversation about an organisation called Atlas Network and whether or not it has influenced the right-bloc government's agenda.

title.children: Growing questions in NZ about organisation called Atlas Network

image.altText: Basket of Easter eggs

props.synopsis: If you're searching for ways to use up your Easter eggs, we've got a few ideas including that include baking, drinking and dipping.

title.children: Leftover Easter eggs? Here are some recipe ideas

image.altText: Kyneton Football and Netball Club coach speaking to players.

props.synopsis: The AFL is set to review the circumstances around Kyneton Football Netball Club's women's side breaking away from the club, as more women's teams fold across the state.

title.children: AFL to review Kyneton women's team situation as more teams fold
